Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. Richard also gets behind the wheel of the BMW M5, which is powered by a twin-turbo V8 engine instead of the high-revving V10 of its predecessor.

programme.title: Storage Hunters

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: American Pickers

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad

programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian makes five train journeys taking in the spectacular sights of Africa, travelling to unexpected places in deserts and forests, villages and cities, and finding out how the railways are used today. He begins in the north, on a line that links the trading cities of Morocco, Algeria and Tunisia. Stocking up for his trip at a souk in Marrakesh, he boards the train for a seven-hour ride to the ancient city of Fes, and eventually reaches the Sahara - and his final destination of Tozeur.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The untold secret story of war production that shaped the Second World War, beginning with how the German aviation industry came to dominate the skies of Europe.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: War Factories

programme.title: War Factories

programme.title: Time Team

programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit Newmarket, where they dig in the heart of the historic Suffolk town in search of the remains of Charles II's racing stables. A mechanical horse and a visit to Ladies' Day add to the excitement, but with limited time and a layer of concrete covering the site, the task proves to be problematic.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Footage of animals that have unusual means of finding their way around. Dung beetles are able to navigate by the sky, using the position of the sun, moon and stars to determine which is the right direction to go in, while pigeons display remarkable powers of memory, able to recall complex travel routes and follow manmade roads and hedgerows.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: The naturalist explores the extremes of birth in the animal kingdom, explaining why the giant panda gives birth to the smallest babies of any existing mammal. He also looks at the kiwi, asking why the bird produces a single egg that is a quarter of its body mass - one of the largest in the world - and almost too big to lay.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the world of omnivores, nature's generalists, revealing their myriad talents in the wild and how some species have adapted to man's encroachment into their habitats by making their homes in cities and towns.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright has a rival for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's attention, as a visitor from Australia - and an old flame of hers- returns to his old stomping ground.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the South Devon Railway, Andy Leech and Liz Turner host afternoon tea for 44 passengers. In East Lancashire, volunteer Chandra Law takes on the new role of Stationmaster.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Hitler's Miracle Weapons
programme.desc: Unusual weapons created by German scientists during the Second World War, including giant cannons, V2 rockets and a 200-ton tank, and how they influenced future arms developments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: The skeleton dubbed the Warrior of Janakkala, found in Finland. The swords buried alongside the man suggest a link between Christians and Pagans and it has been deduced the remains date from the 12th century.

programme.title: Hitler v Churchill: The Eagle and the Lion
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary exploring the rivalry between the leaders of Britain and Germany during the Second World War, and their common experiences during the First World War.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to the Roman legionary fort of Caerleon, in Gwent, where they investigate evidence that a huge structure - a courtyard surrounded by stone buildings - once led from the fort down to the River Usk. Archaeologists from Cardiff University help shed new light on what was once seen solely as a military outpost.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Somerset, where a family of farmers hopes to unearth evidence of a Norman castle believed to have once stood on top of what is known locally as Castle Hill. Records show there used to be such a structure in the area, but there are several likely locations for it. As the dig progresses, an outline of what appears to be a castle keep is revealed, but the findings lead to an unexpected conclusion.

programme.title: Hitler's England
programme.desc: Former Bergerac star John Nettles returns to Jersey to tell the story of the British Channel Islands under German occupation from 1940 to 1945.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: Bizarre events during wartime, featuring a Nazi anti-gravity device, phantom cities built during the Second World War, Stalin's cursed tomb and poultry of mass destruction.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attend questions why spirals are so widespread in nature. He gleans some answers by examining the narwhal's tusk and the spiral shells found on snails and ammonites, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines a zebra's stripes and the wings of a butterfly, as he continues to discover nature's evolutionary anomalies.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at vibrantly coloured monkeys in Venezuela, Costa Rica and West Africa. He encounters the red howler, which boasts one of the loudest calls in the wild, a capuchin that uses a tree as an anvil, the guenon, which communicates via facial expression, and the ground-dwelling gelada baboon.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at Sweden's passion for subterranean spaces and how this nation has taken extraordinary precautions to protect itself - by excavating an astounding 65,000 nuclear bunkers. In south-west England, deep in the Mendip Hills of Somerset, lies one of the most spectacular landscapes in the UK, but beneath this breath-taking landscape sits secret caverns and magical rock formations carved out by nature. Plus, how in Romania, nside a 1.2km-thick layer of salt, sits a world underground first.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and a team of specialist historians travel to Nottinghamshire, where residents of Clipstone village near Sherwood Forest believe some impressive ruins in a farmer's field may have played a part in the ancient tales of Robin Hood and Bad King John. The extensive building records and high-quality carvings prove a fine building existed somewhere nearby, but finding out what it looked like and how large it was frustrates the archaeologists.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson adjudicates a debate to decide the team's greatest discovery to date. With more than 250 digs to consider, many of which retrieved rare and valuable finds in addition to the ones that revealed intriguing archaeological fakery, Mick Aston, Phil Harding and Helen Geake discuss and defend their favourites.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: Documentary uncovering and examining hidden structures built by the Nazis, from tunnels to towers, artillery sites, resistance nests and communication centres. The first edition focuses on the Channel Island of Guernsey, which Hitler occupied and fortified over the course of five years.

programme.sub-title: The First Raid of the Vikings

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough shines the spotlight on some of nature's evolutionary anomalies and how these curious animals continue to baffle and fascinate. In this edition, he examines the unusual ways in which Komodo dragons and aphids reproduce.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: Naturalist David Attenborough explores animal oddities, looking at two different animals with curiously distinctive evolutionary quirks, linked together by a common theme. In this instalment, he examines how hedgehogs and rhinos have developed protective skins.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the startling similarities between humans and great apes, meeting an orang-utan able to row boats and wash clothes and a gorilla that can communicate using sign language. He also traces the history of human settlement and considers the future of population control and food production.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: A profile of Dudley Mason, who was awarded the George Cross after the tanker he was commanding came under attack during Operation Pedestal in August 1942 to relieve Malta.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian begins the next leg of his trip in Kasama, northern Zambia. His first stop is the town of Mpika, where he meets college students training to be locomotive drivers. Next, in the capital Lusaka, he reveals how the first railways were built to access the country's rich mineral wealth, and watches craftsmen cutting emeralds and rubies - before being let loose on a pair of bejewelled cufflinks. Griff then reaches the spectacular Victoria Falls on his way to Zimbabwe's second-largest city, Bulawayo.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: After the death of Cardinal Wolsey in 1530, Thomas Cromwell became Henry VIII's 'lap dog'. In order to do the king's bidding, he established a network of spies that steered Henry through his troubles with Rome, divorces, assassinations attempts and the establishment of a new religion. as this documentary reveals, though cunning and ambitious, none of these achievements proved sufficient to preserve his life.

programme.title: A Very British Murder with Lucy Worsley
programme.desc: The historian tells the story of one of the first high-profile killers - Dr Crippen, who was hanged in 1910 for poisoning and dismembering his wife - before turning her attention to the interwar period, when detective fiction reached the peak of its popularity at the hands of authors Agatha Christie and Dorothy L Sayers. After undergoing the elaborate initiation ceremony of the Detection Club, which was set up by a group of British writers in 1930, Lucy considers how Alfred Hitchcock's films and Graham Greene's books eclipsed the traditional murder-mystery story in the depiction of homicide.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Real Ark of the Covenant
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston goes in search of the location of the real Ark of the Covenant, believed to be held in a chapel in Ethiopia that is now in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates theories that Hitler faked his suicide at the end of the Second World War and may have escaped from his Berlin bunker.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Man In The Iron Mask
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the story of the man in the iron mask, who was held in the Bastille from 1698 to 1703, and may have been imprisoned for 40 years.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Following the wildlife that inhabits the famous American national park, a lost world of deep forests, vast plains and bubbling geysers. The first episode focuses on a variety of species as they struggle to survive the rigours of a freezing six-month winter, revealing that although the herds of elk and bison are weakened by the cold, one animal gets stronger - the wolf.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: Summer returns, transforming the landscape of the famous national park from a frozen wilderness into the ideal environment for newborn animals. As temperatures rise, grizzly bears teach their young the secrets of survival - but even at this time of year, snow can sweep down from the mountains without warning.

programme.title: Yellowstone
programme.desc: An early dusting of snow signals the end of autumn, a time when the forests are a blaze of red and gold and the animals prepare for the coming cold. The elk face hungry wolves as they move down from the mountains to feed in the valleys, while beavers rush to defend their habitat against the destructive ice, repairing dams and stocking underwater larders before the waters freeze over.

programme.title: Tom Jones at the BBC
programme.desc: A celebration of the singer's performances, from the start of his career in the 1960s to his appearance on Later with Jools Holland just before he celebrated his 70th birthday in 2010. The programme includes archive footage of the Welshman's appearances on The Dusty Springfield Show and Top of the Pops.

programme.title: You've Got a Friend: The Carole King Story
programme.desc: The award-winning US singer gives an account of her life, looking back on her upbringing in Brooklyn, and the subsequent success she enjoyed as part of husband-and-wife songwriting team Goffin and King in the 1960s, including the creation of global hits Take Good Care of My Baby, The Locomotion and Will You Love Me Tomorrow. By 1970, Carole was divorced and had moved to Los Angeles, where she created her classic solo album Tapestry. Now in her seventies, she reveals herself to be as much an environmental activist as a musician, lobbying Congress in defence of the wildlife and eco-systems in her beloved Idaho.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Exploring the history of Westminster Abbey, which dates back to the 11th century and houses more than 500 corpses, including those of Edward I, Elizabeth I, Charles Darwin and Isaac Newton, as well as staging 16 royal weddings. The episode also explores the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the somewhat macabre history of Scotland Yard, and revealing the lesser-known facts about one of the world's most famous police stations.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Ffestiniog and Welsh Highland Railway are celebrating their annual Victorian Weekend, while in south Devon, silver service waiter Andy Leech runs the three-course Sunday lunch.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.desc: Elizabeth decides to organise a formal party to demonstrate how out of her depth Sarah is. Meanwhile, Carolyn is shocked by Jack's revelation when she challenges him to confront his intimacy issues, and Regina returns home from Europe with news about Sarah. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is closer to George than ever after her triumph at the Swansons' party. However, their happiness is short-lived when they are faced with Regina's bombshell, which sends shockwaves through Inverness. Romantic drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: Lorna Doone
programme.desc: Lavish adaptation of RD Blackmore's novel of lovers, outlaws and warring families in 17th-century Exmoor. Amelia Warner stars as the eponymous heroine, with Queer as Folk's Aidan Gillen as her evil aristocratic cousin, who wants her for himself at any cost. The cast also includes Richard Coyle, Martin Clunes, Barbara Flynn and Michael Kitchen.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Emotions run high as the regiment is sent on a dangerous assignment to Bosnia, and Phillip's handling of a sensitive situation jeopardises his relationship with Captain Williams.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Gary hunts for Joe, desperate to find his fugitive brother before the vengeful gangsters get their hands on him, but dramatic developments make him wonder if he's been manipulated all along. Elsewhere, as Tony comes to terms with the enormity of what he's done, a witness comes forward accusing him of reckless driving, while Jim is moved to declare his true feelings for June.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Andrea fears her true identity as an undercover reporter could be blown when a journalist visits Sun Hill, while Jim decides to follow a psychic's advice and propose to June. Sheelagh is mortified to see her son arrested for a homophobic hate crime and Lance is furious at Adam for revealing he's gay, while Steve and Cameron find the dead body of a young thug - could he be the latest victim of Gabriel's vigilante campaign?.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Consumed by her desire for revenge, Kerry confronts Gabriel and tells him she intends to prove he's the serial rapist. He isn't remotely fazed by her threats, however, and continues to goad Cameron, provoking a violent outburst in the canteen. Rob pursues his vendetta against the Radford clan by making a rash accusation, and Sheelagh finally loses patience with Lance's persistent hints that her son might be gay.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gabriel demands Cameron be expelled from Sun Hill following the canteen brawl and it seems only Kerry's testimony can save him - but it's doubtful she'll be willing to speak out after jeopardising the hunt for the serial rapist. As the pressure mounts on Cameron, he decides to throw in the towel and return to Australia, leading to an emotional confrontation with his ex-fiancee. Meanwhile, Gina fears Jonathan Fox's passion for her is cooling and Neil becomes increasingly attracted to Andrea - but will he realise she's an undercover reporter?.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: As a grief-stricken Vic and Lucy struggle to come to terms with Peggy's death, life goes on at the health centre, where a man turns nasty when his wife refuses to continue her IVF treatment. Meanwhile, Karen joins the team, but isn't exactly welcomed with open arms, while her husband David starts work at the Goddard's. Rural drama, starring Lesley Dunlop and Leslie Ash..

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Tension mounts between Karen and Jacqui, and an elderly patient confides in Chris, while David comes t o Henry's aid at Goddard's - much to Simon's displeasure. Elsewhere, a patient suspected of having cancer tries to persuade his daughter to accept the new love in his life.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny returns from her stint at the London Hospital and heads straight into one of the most emotive cases of her career when she and Sister Evangelina assist at the birth of a baby with spina bifida. As the parents struggle to come to terms with their son's life-limiting condition, Jenny, who has never delivered a disabled child, also fails to comprehend the far-reaching implications for the family. Meanwhile, Nonnatus House plays host to an acquaintance of Chummy - the Rev Applebee Thornton, an eccentric cleric who befriends Jane. Jessica Raine, Pam Ferris and Dorothy Atkinson star, with a guest appearance by Jason Watkins (Trollied).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The locals excitedly prepare for the summer fete, featuring a baby show for which Trixie volunteers to secure a celebrity judge. Not everyone is in the mood for a party, however, as Jenny finds when she meets Nora Harding, a mother-of-eight distraught that she will soon have another mouth to feed. The midwife does her best to reassure the desperate mum, but her words fall on deaf ears and Nora ends up taking matters into her own hands. Jessica Raine and Helen George star, with a guest appearance by Sharon Small (Mistresses).

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: Feature-length episode of the mystery drama. The sleuthing senior citizen is urged by an old friend to visit her sister as she is convinced something is wrong. Miss Marple heads for the country to investigate and it is not long before a heated argument in a locked room ends with a gunshot that leaves a man dead. Jean Simmons and Joss Ackland guest star, with Joan Hickson.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: The detective takes on his most challenging case as he searches for Linda's father-in-law, with the only clue to his whereabouts being an incident on board a submarine 25 years ago. As the case takes a devastating turn, Wallander is plunged into the shady world of Cold War-era politics and faces a battle to protect his daughter. Final episode of the crime drama, starring Kenneth Branagh.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd investigates a disturbing case of abuse and murder at a children's home as new evidence comes to light about the disappearance of two boys. When an artist's impression of a skeleton found in an archaeological dig matches one of the youngsters, the team tries to determine the identity of the paedophile. Starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Rebus
programme.desc: In the tense build-up to a world trade summit in Edinburgh, Rebus looks forward to a well-earned day off - until Siobhan rings to say a body has been found in the grounds of the hotel hosting the conference. When a government minister is later killed in a fall from the castle ramparts, the abrasive copper comes up against Commander Steelforth of the SO12 unit providing security for the summit and, not for the first time, finds himself at odds with the Establishment. Julie Graham guest stars, with Ken Stott and Claire Price.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The Fusiliers decide to go to a local brothel in Hong Kong, but the visit has unforeseen consequences. Starring Robson Green and Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Colonel Fortune is worried about the prospect of merging with another regiment, and Second Lieutenant Kate Butler faces hostility from the Marines during an exercise.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tom and Ed put Chrissie's loyalty to the test as Zubin and Ric investigate the heart transplant incident - which someone is going to have to take responsibility for. Diane reaches a milestone, Lisa anxiously waits to hear about her promotion and the secrets that have been building up over the past few months finally erupt following an attempt to separate conjoined twins.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Alan Kennedy is in custody but the Sun Hill coppers will soon have to release him unless they can find some hard evidence linking him to the rapes. Determined to extract a confession, Samantha resorts to the unorthodox psychological technique of donning a mini-skirt and revealing blouse - will it be enough to make him crack? Elsewhere, tragedy strikes as Adam attends a summer party held to improve community relations.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant has reservations about abandoning his holiday with Sharon at the last minute, but is determined to show he puts her wishes first.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur Fowler was never too happy at Pete Beale billeted on his family, but is Arthur's life going to get any better without him?.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: On New Year's Eve, Jude finds her locker broken into and all her credit cards and money taken. It transpires the thief is Matt's father, and he implores her not to involve the police. Elsewhere, Daniel gets himself into Mike's bad books for queue-hopping one of the patients from a fund-holding GP.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie enters the political arena, but a murder soon stops his campaign dead in its tracks. Jersey-based detective drama, with John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian's mooning over a new love, Joey's mooning over an old one and Jack's completely besotted with Leonora.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: The department store starts an insurance scheme, prompting the staff to get in shape for the medical. Comedy, starring John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries

But Gerry, who was on the original investigation, refuses to believe the prisoner is anything but guilty. Meanwhile, Brian is in a reflective mood, convinced his days at Ucos are numbered after his actions against former police commander Embleton. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star as the veteran coppers, with Amanda Redman as their boss.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lyell Centre has a new boss in the shape of forensic pathologist Thomas Chamberlain, but he is met with a frosty reception from Nikki, Jack and Clarissa, who are still coming to terms with the death of Leo. Meanwhile, detectives are demanding results in two unsolved cases involving a wealthy mother and son murdered in their London home and the disfigured body of a young woman. Starring Richard Lintern, Emilia Fox, David Caves, Kaye Wragg and Hugo Becker.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Legal action against Larry Cotter proves fruitless, so the sisters decide to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: As the wedding day approaches, Evie feels it is time she met her in-laws, but Daniel's response is less than encouraging.

programme.title: Garden Hopping

programme.desc: The company is sent to New Zealand for a training exercise, where Paddy and Dave take a new recruit under their wing. Guest starring Lena Headey.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

On the anniversary of baby Amanda's death, Mubbs tells Chrissie the identity of the father, while Diane reveals to Owen that she has been raped in the past.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. The bomb attack on the summer party leaves Adam hovering on the brink of death, and while Tony valiantly risks his own life to rescue his stricken superior, Lance's reluctance to put himself in danger causes him to question his future in the force. Jack's ex-lover Rachel Heath claims he is the father of her baby son and begs him to help retrieve him from the clutches of a religious fanatic, while Gina wonders how to tell Jonathan just how she feels about him.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Pilot episode of the crime drama, starring Amanda Redman as Superintendent Sandra Pullman, a rising star of the Met who is sidelined after a failed hostage rescue. Put in charge of a new department, she is dismayed to discover the unit is to be manned by a motley crew of old-school former detectives who know little about modern police procedure. However, when they re-examine the case of a man whose conviction for murder 20 years ago has just been overturned, their combined experience and unorthodox methods bring interesting results. Alun Armstrong, Dennis Waterman and James Bolam play Redman's veteran team, with Jon Finch, Tim Woodwork and Philip Bretherton.

It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? Emilia Fox stars, with appearances from Tobias Menzies, Michael Socha and Aaron McCusker.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved murder of pornographer Jim Hockney is reopened when his daughter Sara provides DNA proof he wasn't her father. The team tries to track down jazz singer Angela Gold, who was the victim's girlfriend at the time and disappeared from the music scene after being acquitted of the crime, and it's Brian's replacement Danny Griffin (Nicholas Lyndhurst) who manages to find her. However, with Angela professing her innocence and Sara's mother Jane also arousing suspicion, it becomes a struggle to determine who is telling the truth. With a guest appearance by former Corrie killer Brian Capron.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack travel to Scotland to examine the body of a lap dancer found in a remote forest, and the search for a suspect brings them into conflict with a couple of rogue city cops. However, when more remains are discovered, it becomes clear they are looking for a serial killer - and news of the crimes preys deeply on the mind of a young mother who is harbouring a dark secret. Emilia Fox and David Caves star, with appearances from Martin Compston (Line of Duty) and Gary Lewis (Billy Elliot).

programme.desc: Australian drama about a hedonistic heart surgeon, Dr Hugh Knight, who is forced to work as a rural GP in his hometown of Whyhope. Starring Rodger Corser.

programme.desc: Sandra and the team investigate why five years earlier a man seemingly vanished during his morning run and has not been seen since. Could he have had something to do with his son-in-law's disappearance? Amanda Redman, Nicholas Lyndhurst, Denis Lawson and Dennis Waterman star.

programme.title: Silent Witness

From the placenta they are able to identify the father - but the married man in question denies any knowledge of the deceased. Emilia Fox, David Caves and Richard Lintern star in the forensic crime drama, with guest appearances by Morven Christie and Sean Gallagher.

programme.desc: A schoolgirl's killing brings Gently into the alien world of pop and media celebrity when it turns out the victim's best friend is a rising TV star. But when it seems everyone has a different opinion of the girl, Gently must uncover these different faces to get to the truth of her murder. Neil Morrissey guest stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra and her seasoned colleagues reopen the case of a political aide's murder when a dormant offshore bank account containing 40,000 is discovered in his name. Ben Ransley was killed in 1997 on the evening of Labour's landslide victory and in his wallet was a photo of a beautiful blonde. But neither his mother nor his best friend was able to identify the mystery woman. Is she the key to the crime? Drama, with former Brookside star John McArdle (Billy Corkhill), Jason Durr of Heartbeat fame and one-time Bad Girls actress Kika Mirylees joining Denis Lawson, Dennis Waterman and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters.

Sean Bean, Elizabeth Hurley and Pete Postlethwaite star.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Fifteen Streets
programme.desc: Feature-length drama based on Catherine Cookson's novel set in early 20th-century Newcastle. Worker John O'Brien lives near poverty in a small house in the workers district, yet falls in love with teacher Mary, daughter of a rich family. Despite the pressures exerted by the social difference, the vigorous Mary refuses to allow outer circumstances destroy their relationship. Starring Sean Bean and Clare Holman.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Green-fingered amateur detectives Laura and Rosemary are called in to tackle a stubborn species of weed threatening an entire year's vintage at the Crickle Valley vineyard. However, they find themselves in the right place at the right time when the body of a wine critic is discovered on the premises. Murder mystery, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.desc: Sarah arrives in Paris, hoping to reconnect with her husband, and is shocked by what she finds. Elizabeth pushes George to be truthful, but causes more damage to their already fragile relationship. Regina puts the next stage of her plan into action, and while Anna finds out the truth about her real father, Olivia proves the depths she is prepared to go to in order to save her marriage.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah returns to Inverness with Rene, but may have underestimated her feelings for George. Olivia finds the burden of deception weighs heavily, while Anna and Gino prepare for their wedding day.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Rene suspects he is standing in the way of Sarah's happiness after witnessing a moment of yearning, while Andrew disturbs Anna and Gino's honeymoon bliss. Elsewhere, George makes an announcement.

programme.desc: Ken and Harry pose as conference organisers in a bid to prove the innocence of a former head of security at a leading hotel, while Rocky and Alex carry out an elaborate burglary.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: Nature documentary revealing how animals cope with the demands of raising their offspring. The first episode follows newborn lambs and foals as their mothers help them to learn to walk, a gorilla in a safari park going through a difficult birth and a white rhino mutilated by hunters that gives birth to a calf, but will have a hard time protecting it. Plus, a look at how highland cows and pigs nurse their young - and a seal that is not able to. Featuring Adam Henson, narrated by Hugh Bonneville.

programme.desc: The roll-out of GDF rescue machines runs into trouble when one malfunctions during a ground-to-space rescue operation.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare will see him attempt a bungee jump, but has he got the nerve to launch himself off the side of the Tees Transporter bridge?.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Chaotic cartoon capers following the further adventures of the popular halfwit immortalised in the live-action TV series and Hollywood film. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Weasel tries for his AeroFizz pilot's license. Magoo ruins everything when, convinced he's fixing his roof, he pierces a hole in the airship..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel shoot people with toy arrows to make them fall in love with Fizz. But Magoo mistakes them for a giant hornet..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz rehearses a dance number that'll make him a star. But when Weasel catapults him next door onto the roof, Magoo thinks he's a stray alien.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Spy School
programme.desc: The rookies must uncover Goldfist's latest darstardly plot to take over the world with misinformation and lies!.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: The presenter turns her attention to child-friendly baking, making a festive reindeer cake, a gingerbread house cake, and snowmen cakes.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner create a crowd-pleasing menu, including vol-au-vents, baked camembert with cheese straws and mince pies.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Nisha Katona create a family feast from India, including tea-steeped chickpeas with black cardamom rice for breakfast, and gingerbread lamb raan for dinner.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The bell-ringers of Midsomer Wellow are mysteriously murdered one by one - and it seems an ancient rhyme may hold the key to the killer's motive. As Barnaby and Troy embark on a baffling investigation in an attempt to determine the truth, Joyce starts digging into the past to discover the assassin's motives. John Nettles, Daniel Casey and Hugh Bonneville star.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five family members from Lincoln answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Warwick Davis hosts.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under 15.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents a festive episode in which celebrity contestants John Inverdale, Judy Murray, Bernard Cribbins and Scarlett Moffatt pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts an I'm A Celebrity special of the game show. Former campmates Joel Dommett, Dean Gaffney and Rosemary Shrager all try to guess well-known phrases and attempt to win the50,000 jackpot for their chosen charity.

programme.title: Not the Robbie Williams Christmas Show
programme.desc: In a one-off special recorded at London's Alexandra Palace Theatre, the singer performs classic hits, plus new Christmas songs. He's also joined by guests including David Walliams and Jamie Cullum.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Final
programme.desc: They've survived until the end after enduring Bushtucker Trials, camp life and each other. But which of the finalists will you crown this year's King or Queen of the Jungle? Ant and Dec reveal which of the campmates will follow in the footsteps of 2018 winner Harry Redknapp. It's been a rollercoaster ride of a contest, with highlights including the windy skyscraper challenge on day one, and the moment Jacqueline Jossa had to face her fear of spiders in an early challenge. While Caitlyn Jenner has become a show favourite, it remains to be seen who will emerge from the camp victorious.

programme.title: Hatton Garden: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Ross Kemp examines the April 2015 heist in London's diamond district, when a group of career criminals broke into a safe deposit facility and stole approximately 14million in precious metals, cash and jewels, an event dubbed the biggest burglary of its type in British history. The documentary gains access to the secret surveillance material that put the thieves behind bars and features exclusive interviews with the detectives who cracked the case as well as Kenny Collins, one of the thieves involved.

programme.title: Paul O'Grady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: This time, the comedian meets an agoraphobic dog who is too scared to go outside, before an unusually quiet chihuahua arrives with a suspected injury to her leg. Later, Paul is introduced to a group of four Japanese chin crosses who have not being getting on well with each other and need to be separated.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland visit Chiddingstone Castle in Kent, where they invite three teams of enthusiasts to compete to find the most rare and valuable items. Whoever wins each round gets first choice in the Masterpiece Challenge, a room filled with antiques, one of which is worth more than 10,000. At the end of the show each team reveals what its members think is the masterpiece and whoever chooses the most masterpieces wins 1,000

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo begins this week in the Italian food capital of Bologna, where he picks up a snack for his journey - the Bolognese classic panino with mortadella. He then boards the train and heads towards the rice growing region of Mantova, where he helps out in the paddies and makes a chocolate rice pudding. He then visits Verona, home of one of the country's oldest art schools. Here he models for the students in their life-drawing class before serving up meatballs in tomato sauce for the young artists.

Elsewhere, Tim springs a surprise proposal on Sally, and new parents Gemma and Chesney bring their babies home.

programme.title: The X Factor: The Band
programme.desc: The third in this new four-part talent show in which Simon Cowell searches for the next big singing group, hoping he can find a band to follow in the footsteps of previous X Factor success stories as One Direction, Fifth Harmony and Little Mix. Groups discovered on The X Factor have sold more than 400 million records.The winner of this show will be signed to Cowell's record label - but will they prove just as successful as their X Factor predecessors?.

programme.title: The Royal Variety Performance
programme.desc: Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan host the annual entertainment extravaganza from the London Palladium, attended this year by the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge. This year's show features music from Robbie Williams, Jamie Cullum, Emeli Sande, Lewis Capaldi, the Kanneh Masons and Mabel, as well as this year's Britain's Got Talent winner, Colin Thackery, and comedy from Frank Skinner, Kerry Godliman and Flo & Joan. There are also appearances from the casts of West End shows Groan Ups, Mary Poppins and Come from Away, and dance spectacle from Zurcaroh and Cirque du Soleil.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the game show in which two teams of friends must battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges. At the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000. This week's teams are the Boro Bouncers from Middlesbrough and the Beach Chums from Cleethorpes.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Virgil and Gordon come to the aid of a transport vehicle carrying a volatile cargo across a treacherous mountain pass that gets intro trouble. However, they soon discover that someone is trying to hijack it.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny takes on a BMX champion at the UK's national cycling centre. Can he win the race or will he get the cream pie forfeit?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo forgets to include Mr Cat in his letter to Santa! To make amends he follows Weasel, dressed as an elf, who leads him to the AeroFizz..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is determined to make the best cup of java, ever. Oh, and to get rich brewing it..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Gran needs new teeth. Probably not wise to nab a set found on the side of the road though, under a full moon..

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer.

programme.title: Mighty Magiswords!
programme.desc: Vambre and Prohyas return to Adventure Academy where Professor Cyrus sends them on a quest to find the Legendary Knowledge Magisword..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.sub-title: James Martin's Saturday Morning at Christmas
programme.desc: The chef is back in the kitchen in the run-up to Christmas with festive food and guests including Johnny Vegas, Aled Jones, chef Paul Ainsworth and Nicola Lando. Plus, wine guru Oz Clarke is taste-testing the best wines on supermarket shelves.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner create a crowd-pleasing menu, including vol-au-vents, baked camembert with cheese straws and mince pies.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and Nisha Katona create a family feast from India, including tea-steeped chickpeas with black cardamom rice for breakfast, and gingerbread lamb raan for dinner.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino D'Acampo begins this week in the Italian food capital of Bologna, where he picks up a snack for his journey - the Bolognese classic panino with mortadella. He then boards the train and heads towards the rice growing region of Mantova, where he helps out in the paddies and makes a chocolate rice pudding. He then visits Verona, home of one of the country's oldest art schools. Here he models for the students in their life-drawing class before serving up meatballs in tomato sauce for the young artists.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Scott investigate the murder of a prize-winning author on the eve of the Midsomer Literary Festival. The event goes ahead as planned, but a killing occurs during a blackout at a packed reception hosted by the widow of another writer, and it is not long before the detectives uncover corruption, sexual scandal and financial mismanagement. Guest starring Stella Gonet, with John Nettles and John Hopkins.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness hosts a one-off 1980s edition of the dating game. A group of men enters the 'love lift' in the hope of impressing 30 single women and winning a date - but must first get the female participants to keep their lights on as a sign of approval.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Angellica Bell, Oritse Williams, Leslie Ash and Ian Lavender pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)
programme.desc: In a galaxy far, far away, Jyn Erso - the maverick daughter of scientist Galen Erso - joins the Rebel Alliance. On the planet Scarif, she and the freedom fighters, including a blind warrior and a deadpan droid, attempt to steal plans for the Death Star, a battle station capable of destroying entire worlds, which was designed by her father on behalf of the Empire. However, the Rebels face tough competition from Imperial warlord Orson Krennic and shadowy forces, including Darth Vader, who will come to play a major part in the rise of the Empire. Star Wars prequel set before the events of A New Hope, starring Felicity Jones, Diego Luna and Ben Mendelsohn.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined on the sofa by Cats stars Rebel Wilson and Jason Derulo, promoting the big-screen version of the famous Andrew Lloyd Webber musical. World Cup-winning England cricketer Jofra Archer, Rocketman actor Taron Egerton and former Bake Off presenter Mel Giedroyc also drop by, and there is music by Keane.

programme.title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here!
programme.sub-title: I'm a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! Coming Out
programme.desc: Just a few days after the new King or Queen of the jungle was crowned, Ant and Dec present the usual round-up of what happened behind the scenes as each campmate was voted out. From the first to the last, the programme reveals what they get up to in their first few days of freedom, and captures their reactions to old rivals and trusted friends, while their families gather for emotional reunions with their loved ones.

programme.title: Animal Mums
programme.desc: How animals raise their young, revealing how elephants and vervet monkeys will work together to look after all the youngsters in a social group. The programme also features a lioness with eight boisterous cubs and sheep farmers who reveal how lambs learn to recognise their mothers' voices, reveals how gannets and seals find their way back to their offspring, and demonstrates some bad behaviour among young goats and orangutans.
